page.title: 06Health Care Provisions
page.content: The villages of Great and Little Raveley and Wistow come under the auspices of Huntingdon Area Health Authority. The population chooses between two practices, one in a Health Centre in Ramsey, the other, a private practice, in Warboys. Both are five miles distant so the home visiting rate for the doctors is fairly high. Patients requiring hospital care go to Peterborough or Huntingdon. Both practices can provide comprehensive facilities which include minor surgery, the visits of school and district nurses, Health Visitors and Social Workers. Clinics are held for diabetes, chiropody, ante-natal care and dental treatment. Current problems are bronchitis, arthritis and a high degree of asthma in children. Time will tell whether pesticides will affect the area's health in future.
